website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a small speaker stand for your work desktop, this does what it's supposed to do.
pros: If you need to dedicate most of your work desk for work-related items, these stands won't be in the way
cons: They're not ugly, but they're not pretty
If that doesn't matter, they'll do the trick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a fan of the Audioengine A2+ stands because they look so plain. So, I decided to go with these Kanto S2 stands, I like the design better and they’re also cheaper than the former. The stand fits perfectly with my white Audioengine A2+ speakers!
customer_reviews.author: Louie Y.

customer_reviews.title: Best speaker stand for desktops!
customer_reviews.text: Got this version for my audioengine a2! This is much better then audioengine's default rubber stands which becomes sticky and breaks over time. Perfect fit as seen in my photo. Comes well packaged and includes a microfibre pouch for transportation! Stand is well padded at contact points to avoid scratches to your precious speakers. Elevates the speakers to direct sound towards my ear. Stands are sturdy and does not flex under the weight of the speakers. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ming Jun

customer_reviews.title: They work with Sonos (Play:1, Sonos One & Sonos One SL)
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use with a pair of Sonos Play:1 speakers and they worked fine. They are a tiny bit on the small side, but do the job if your speakers stay put in a low-traffic spot. Mine are on a window sill behind my sofa where they serve as the rear L&R surround sound speakers, hence my need to angle them up. I would think twice if my speakers were on my work desk or somewhere they could be constantly knocked over. The stands are just little metal wedges and seem a bit overpriced, but they do they do look much better than the rubber alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: JoseAntonio

customer_reviews.title: Great for Audioengine HD3
customer_reviews.text: I like these and they work well in angling up my Audioengine HD3 speakers. I think they look a little more stylish than the AudioEngine wedges. Yeah they are probably overpriced, but they help small desktop speakers sound a lot better and look good too. They are the perfect size for the HD3's in case anyone is interested.
customer_reviews.author: 2wheelfish

customer_reviews.title: Solid stands - perfect for the Kanto YU2
customer_reviews.text: So I dig these. Not much to say other than beware they are not adjustable at all. I wasnt sure and didnt really do much research. I love the look and the angle. However, if you have limited headroom (like under my monitor shelf), they dont adjust. It's totally fine and I am still happy with my purchase. My setup requires the speakers to be slightly outside what I would consider optimal "sound stage" but they still sound great. Love these speakers and just ordered the sub (auditioned these with mostly acoustic music -anything more than that really needs the sub). Good price. Great quality and a perfect fit. Buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker stand for Minirig 3
customer_reviews.text: The Minirig 3 is the best Bluetooth speaker that I have ever owned. The problem with the Minirig is that it is designed to lay with the speaker pointing up. I found that they are amazing directional speakers so I got another one to work as a pair. I couldn't find any speaker stands designed for them. I almost gave up looking and was going to DIY it. I happened to have these from another pair of speakers so I gave it a try. Now I can easily set it up to point towards me any place I take them.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wong

customer_reviews.title: They look great (they look WAY better than some plastic black wedges)
customer_reviews.text: They look great (they look WAY better than some plastic black wedges), hold my passive P4 speakers at the perfect angle with zero "give" when you put them on the stands, was hesitant to spend the money until I heard the sound difference. Highly recommended, might seem pricey until you think they have to support 6 pounds and are small / lightweight, it's not like they are iPad stands that only have to support 2lbs
customer_reviews.author: Ryan_H_DC

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy for KEF LSX
customer_reviews.text: Almost a perfect fit with KEF LSX, way cheaper than the $179 KEF desk pads, looks pretty good too. At first I thought they were just a bit wobbly if you move/touch the speakers but after about a week the weight of the LSX (~7lbs) flattened them out. They can easily be bent back up to the desired angle, but it is going to sag. Maybe the stainless steel would be better, but it is still rated at 6lbs. The bigger S4 stand would be bigger than the base of this compact speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: For my application these worked perfectly. I needed to angle my AudioEngine A2+’s on my gaming desk to make them work with the oversized monitor I failed to account for when purchasing everything. Worked wonderfully with the speakers mounting just right and quite sturdy with no perceived vibration transferred to the desk. Good product, slightly spendy, but would recommend to anyone wasting a ton of money on a custom gaming rig.
customer_reviews.author: Carly Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my Bose 1-2-3 speakers. Know this product wasn’t made for them specifically but they work perfectly. Reduced vibration- had the speakers directly on a table top before. Nice angle to project sounds upwards. Very sturdy and blends right in with the speakers-doesn’t look clunky. Very pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: MMS

customer_reviews.title: Just great.
customer_reviews.text: I like these. Using with Audio Engine 2’s, I think they’re called. The smaller matte black, glossy red or white. Perfect fit, and the backsides are lower then the matching Audio Engine plastic tilt stands, which are also great just taller. With these I can fit the tilted speakers under the bottom of my LG 34” curved computer monitors, left right, as seen from my eyeline sitting in my computer chair looking down.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Just the right angle.
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually using these on the top of my book shelfs. One on each side of the sofa. With speakers pointing down. Currently its part of a 7.1 surround system as the back speakers, but will be the height speakers once I upgrade to a new receive with the Atmos option (5.1.2). They could also work pointing up for the same function (Atmos). Will see.
customer_reviews.author: Geraldo Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Audioengine A2/ A2+ speakers!
customer_reviews.text: I moved from a large sit down desk to a smaller standing desk. I needed speakers that fit on the desk that sounded great. Audioengine sells some rubber wedges for around the same price, but I'm glad I found these. They angle it upwards towards your ears, which is essential for nearfield spakers. I think they look great and could probably house even bigger speakers if needed. Definitely a must for the Audioengine A2 / A2+ speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo

customer_reviews.title: Love them! Makes my audioengine speakers stand out more!
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery with my free prime trial. Well I own a pair of audioengine A2 small speakers and I was about to purchase the speaker stands that audioengine sells but I found these Kanto S2 stands for a good price and better build quality. They fit perfectly for my audioengine A2 speakers. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Good for $$
customer_reviews.text: All seems nice. Light, slip-free, holds the speakers. HOWEVER, these might get a bit shaky with the desk if you got slip-free-pads on the bottom of your pair. So if you got those, and things moving on your peripheral when you do your thing bothers you, might look into other stands. But I can tolerate it so im happy
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: They just sit there...looking pretty.
customer_reviews.text: Actually they support the YU2 speakers from Kanto real well. You'd do good to purchase them when you purchase a set of Kanto speakers. However if you go anything bigger than YU2, get the next size up. It also helps keep the speakers off the desk, and angled slightly up for a better listening experience.
customer_reviews.author: B. A.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Using them for a pair of audioengine p4's. Disregarded these because the dimensions seemed small for these speakers, but took the chance because of one review saying otherwise. He/she was right; they work great for the p4's. They do give a little under the weight, but not significantly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great for near field
customer_reviews.text: For the cost, I wasn't expecting that much. This was just supposed to hold me over til I found which vibration dampening mounts that I wanted to permanently use. Instead, I'm still using these on my Micca mb42x's on a near-field setup and I don't think I'll need to upgrade the stands for as long as I have these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey A. Nasution

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced, But good quality and very stylish.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect stands for the Audioengine A2+ Speakers. (Even though those speakers are a RIP OFF. For real, you can buy much much nicer sounding speakers with a sub included for that price.) BUT.. if you have to have those speakers for some reason, these are the absolute best stands you can buy.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Good looking speaker stands, using them on the Kanto YU4
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, it does what it's meant to do, places your speakers on a level that you should hear them better and prevent some vibrations, and it does it on a metal stand that feels veeery solid and doesn't seem to damage the speakers because of the padding.
customer_reviews.author: Mario T.

customer_reviews.title: They are pretty light duty aluminum
customer_reviews.text: Using with a pair of Micca MB42X speakers in my office. It helps quite a bit with imaging especially at low volume. For the price, I would have not minded them to be a bit heavier. They are pretty light duty aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: S. Finney

customer_reviews.title: The angle is perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I've had these about 8 months now and they have surpassed my expectations. I wanted low profile speaker stands to support bookshelf speakers on my desk. The angle is perfect for my needs. My biggest concern was that the stands would collapse over time but they still support the speakers very well. Recommended! Update: I've had these going on two years now and they still look great! This photo was taken after 20 months of continuous use.
customer_reviews.author: BellOnWheels

customer_reviews.title: They are a perfect fit. Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my Kanto Yu2 speakers. They are a perfect fit. Very good quality, the metal is solid and strong. It also has foam padding on the contact surfaces on the top and bottom to eliminate slipping (and possibly vibrations as well). My only gripe is that I wish it was angled higher. To actually be pointed at my ears, I would have to sit about 5 feet away.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Seahorse

customer_reviews.title: Super small, watch the dimensions!
customer_reviews.text: Wow this came half as big as expected, I should have looked more carefully on the dimensions. This should not cost more than $10, totally overpriced with $40+. Nice item and does the job, but due to the price I took off 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Las Vegas Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Work perfectly with my Kanto YU2 speakers. They probably are not needed if you can put the speakers at ear level or close to it, but mine sit on my desk on either side of the computer monitor. I needed the stands to direct the awesome YU2's to my ears. These stands are stable, and do not slide around on the desk. I could not ask for anything better. White matches perfectly with the white YU2's as well!
customer_reviews.author: SneakierEmperor

customer_reviews.title: Decent stands for your pretty speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my Kanto Yu2 speakers. Overall construction and material quality is fair. Certainly not the strongest of aluminum, but holds the speakers just fine. I do appreciate the modern design language and the addition of the pre installed foam. I think the price is a bit high for what they are which is why I'm giving these 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Lonestarcollector

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Complement to Kanto YU2 Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I skimped when I bought my speakers and tried propping them up with a book or a pad of post-it notes. But that didn't work well and it looked messy. Now, with these stands I've got the perfect amount of tilt and the stands—what you can see of them—looks good.
customer_reviews.author: David Salahi

customer_reviews.title: Elevates just fine for less muffled sounds
customer_reviews.text: Not much to write here. They do what they were meant to do, elevate a small speaker. They are sturdy, feel well made, and works perfectly for my center Bose Series 10 v 3 speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Keithian

customer_reviews.title: Great product for bookshelf speakers
customer_reviews.text: I was using yoga blocks to raise my speakers. Wish I would have bought these in the first place. They look much nicer and don't take up as much space and provide a great angle for better audio when working at my desk. Using these with MB42 speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Homar

customer_reviews.title: Nice small stands.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, little stands in premium packaging. Puchased for a passive sound bar that well exceeds the maximum rated weight but they fit perfectly and work great. I use them to angle up from a low shelf, which they do, but am surprised how much it improves the detail of sound by isolating the cabinet from the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Might Sag after awhile. Have some Edifier Speakers on them
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price. They might eventually sag down. So you will have to re-adjust them. That is why for the low stars.
customer_reviews.author: Victor W. Chu

customer_reviews.title: Stylish little stands, get them while you can!
customer_reviews.text: I looked high and low for something like these, and I finally found it! Discontinued, of course, but these stands are gorgeous to look at, remarkably sturdy, and are perfect for close-in speakers given their higher than average tilt.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for Audioengine A2+ Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my Audioengine A2+ speakers, and they fit great. Just what I wanted. (Black Friday discount of 33% off was an added bonus!)
customer_reviews.author: Runswithdogs in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice
customer_reviews.text: My center speaker sits on a shelf below the TV, which means the sound points at my knees instead of my ears. The Kanto stands are made for desktop speakers, but by using BOTH stands on either side of my speaker, I was able to provide a stable upward facing front speaker.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker stands
customer_reviews.text: The stands look great and make a perfect addition to your speakers. The stands are adjustable too so you can adjust the angles to however you like. They are sturdy and won't shake.
customer_reviews.author: Tan Pham

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but be aware of strength.
customer_reviews.text: Look and material are great but functionality wise, not so much. Was hoping they would be able to hold up Micca RB42 speakers since they are slim but long. The speakers immediately folded them flat. Put a pencil in them to support the weight and it seems fine now. I would imagine these will struggle to hold longer speakers also.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Woodfield

customer_reviews.title: They do what they're supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: Not too fancy or perhaps an awesome value, they give S2 speakers just the right tilt on the desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Adagietto

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: When purchasing the Audioengine A2+ speakers, Amazon suggested the Audioengine stands which are plastic and also $35. That's definitely not something I wanted. These, though, are doing great for less. I'm very happy with this buy.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Perfect desk speaker stands
customer_reviews.text: Perfect desk speaker stands. I was on a quest for something like this years ago with no luck. Kanto hit out out of the park with these.
customer_reviews.author: KetelOne

customer_reviews.title: Good product; works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for the Kanto YU2 speakers I have. The speakers are now at a very good angle for my office desk setup. Recommended if you have a traditional desktop PC/Mac arrangement. They set on either side of my monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Johnney Hall

customer_reviews.title: Essential for a sound bar
customer_reviews.text: Whoa. Bought these for a Vizio 3.0 sound bar and the difference is amazing. Sounds way better because there’s less vibration between the sound bar and the surface plus the angle makes the sound hit your face directly. Such a small tweak makes a huge difference. Very pleased. Pricey but comes in a nice little satin sack and once I heard the results I forgot about the price. Super recommended.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Fits Edifier 4" R1280DB perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, well-made product. Exactly as described. Fits under the Edifier 4" R1280DB studio monitor speakers perfectly. Sits right between the little foam foot pads.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Junkies

customer_reviews.title: Dose it's job, pretty nice quality
customer_reviews.text: I chose the wrong size, It seems too small for my 4' speaker, but it works well once I balance and place them right. I can't tell a lot about the sound since I have a noisy desktop computer, but it do prevent scratches for both the speakers and the desk
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Great stands
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had an issue. They hold the speakers up well and look great.
customer_reviews.author: Dreygyr

customer_reviews.title: Really elegant and minimal, can also tilt downwards as well.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my JVC HR5. As I wanted to place the speakers on the shelf above my monitor, I was looking for ways to tilt them downwards. I'm glad that this stand allows me to do so easily, just by flipping the speakers over.
customer_reviews.author: Kent

customer_reviews.title: Worst than nothing.
customer_reviews.text: Do the job, the aluminum frame is ok, some dents. The big problem is those foamy pads. to lay the speakers are ok, but the feet-foam has no friction at all, very slippery I'll remove everything to put some rubber pads.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Malacara

customer_reviews.title: Perfect accessory.
customer_reviews.text: Precisely what you'd expect. Good materials and workmanship. The angle really improves the audio imaging.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Good stands, although a bit overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Good stands, although a bit overpriced. The back of the stands are perfect because there's a square space you could use to pass wires through holes you drilled into your desk
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Micca MB42X
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use with my Micca MB42X Bookshelf Speakers. They work perfectly, sturdy design and small profile. They look great sitting on my desk now.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Good for small speakers under 4inch speakers
customer_reviews.text: they look tough but its only for small speakers. wont work for studio monitors besides the pre sonus 3.5
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Really nice and priced well.
customer_reviews.text: Looks very good and are much stronger than I thought they would be.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie S. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for small desktop speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for small desktop (or smaller bookshelf) speakers; angle is easily adjusted if desired. Liked these so much I bought a second set, two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: E J Henderson

customer_reviews.title: A bit overpriced but is well made.
customer_reviews.text: These should really be closer to maybe 9.99 or 14.99 max but they match my Kanto YU2s so I went ahead and bought them. They have foam cushions to prevent the speakers from being scratched.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Better than the old foam stuff I used to have
customer_reviews.text: Better than the old foam stuff I used to have. Expensive but I'm sure I'll have this (along with my speakers for many years to come).
customer_reviews.author: Jack Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Very useful.
customer_reviews.text: Work just fine. Support my Bose Companion® 2 Series III multimedia speaker perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Spagnuolo

customer_reviews.title: Best one yet
customer_reviews.text: I love this, it lets the studio speaker point at an angle to get more out of your studio monitors. Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: abraham ibale

customer_reviews.title: Very minimal
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy how sleek they look when paired with the Kanto yu2. I guess a gripe could be that they could be a bit more sturdy but thats a nitpick considering it's more than enough to support the speakers
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: These are a lot nicer looking than I expected. Really good quality , great finish texture, excellent packaging. If I had more speakers I'd buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: Tony B

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and functional
customer_reviews.text: I love these stands. They look really good with my Audioengine A2+ speakers.
customer_reviews.author: S. Christian

customer_reviews.title: Good product, works as intended used in reverse on ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product, works as intended used in reverse on some Def Tech Pro1000s and some Klipsch smaller speakers I use for computer gaming.
customer_reviews.author: AstroCat

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and modern
customer_reviews.text: If you have Kanto speakers, these stands are a must. Uncomplicated. Your speakers will not budge with the rubber on the top of each stand. Sturdy and modern. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Smartmouth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these on larger speakers and they work well once you get them balanced on the stands.
customer_reviews.author: george karagiorgios

customer_reviews.title: Perfect purchase
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be a great buy. Made from solid metal and props my speakers up perfectly. Great value
customer_reviews.author: william van rickley

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is that I would prefer they be included with the speakers at that price point.
customer_reviews.author: JEREMY F

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and functional, if a bit pricey
customer_reviews.text: Seems a bit pricey for what they are, but they match nicely with my Kanto YU2 speakers and provide a nice solid base. In my particular setup, definitely seemed to improve sound quality by pointing the speakers more towards my listening position and helping to isolate the speaker vibrations from the surface of my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Simple, stylish improvement
customer_reviews.text: Made a clear difference in the sound: better definition and soundfield. I'm apparently in the minority but $20-ish seems reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: nosnittap

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great speaker stands with minimal footprint on S2 computer speakers, it's a must-have!
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, fit my Kanto speakers and tilts them towards my ears
customer_reviews.author: dstroyer71

customer_reviews.title: A perfect fit for my JBL control one mini bookshelf speakers
customer_reviews.text: Compact design, lifts the output to a proper level. A perfect fit for my JBL control one mini bookshelf speakers
customer_reviews.author: will0754

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Kanto speakers
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the Kanto speakers. I still need to adjust positions for sound improvement but these are another good addition to a fresh desk setup.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Finch

customer_reviews.title: Just what i need
customer_reviews.text: These little stands are well packaged by Kanto and really fit my Audioengine HD3, look pretty nice also!
customer_reviews.author: 張博勛

customer_reviews.title: Used for my Mackie CR3, Perfect for small speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. Add style for my set-up. Very light weight but sturdy. The additional foam on both top and bottom provides support for the sound impact from the speaker itself. Keep it up Kanto and Amazon. Thanks a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Rawland Uy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Work exactly as they should. Not giving them 5 stars because I think they're a bit overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Spingarn

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Make real defferent when tilting the speaker facing towards you.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: too pricey, but good product
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but way too pricey for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Janice B

customer_reviews.title: good quality and logic price
customer_reviews.text: I bought them for my Audioengine A2+ Elegant speaker stands, good quality and logic price.
customer_reviews.author: Theodor K.

customer_reviews.title: Solid weight, does the job well.
customer_reviews.text: Simple and exactly as described. I do like the foam on everything that would touch the speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: So worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Must have. if you want to add to the sounds, get these. Built really well too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The bass is still very good quality considering that you just propped the speaker up ...
customer_reviews.text: They are a stand. so not really a "love it" type of thing. The bass is still very good quality considering that you just propped the speaker up off the playing surface. Don`t believe me? Try Imagine Dragons and see for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: break_fix

customer_reviews.title: ... but they really do angle the speakers to the perfect degree.
customer_reviews.text: Expensive for little metal stands but they really do angle the speakers to the perfect degree.
customer_reviews.author: Jedi Master

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but seem overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is high, but they are smaller than I expected. My Optimus Pro LX5 speakers fit them nicely.
customer_reviews.author: P. Versage

product_meta.title: Kanto S2 Desktop Speaker Stands for Small Speakers, White
feature_bullets: Low profile design for desktop speakers, ideal for YU2s
Built out of solid aluminum with a painted finish
Foam isolation pads to reduce vibration
Measures 3.9'' wide by 5.3'' long and holds up to 6 lb per stand

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars283 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
